column4: Hey guys, I need help with a problem, I'm not getting any sound out of my speakers..
Yea, they are fine, my friend suggested that my speakers weren't set as the default playing device but I'm not quite sure how to set them..  Running: xubuntu
Ah, i wouldn't know where in X these settings are, can you configure your sound device through the soundspeaker icon in your tray?
Hang on a second I'll check.
Good call, I was able to set it as the default device alright.  I'll just test it now, brb.
No luck :(.  Could it be a problem with gstreamer?

Are the settings for all devices you can configure through that interface set correctly? try messing with different setting combinations for the devices, I'm runing gnome, and I've found that only some configurations work correctly (especially when you have multiple sound outputs)
I'm a noob to linux, and I'm afraid I didn't quite follow that..
How do I mess with the settings?
ah, ok, well, are the volume levels for your device set correctly?
for instance, if you select the proper default device for playback, are all the switches set to full volume?
NOpe they aren't all set to full.
try setting them to full, on all possible devices, and then go through each device, testing whether the sound works
I'll get my friend to come up later and have a look at it :P  Thanks for all the help though! :)
